prompt: Professor, what is the true meaning of a word?
Do you believe the world is getting better or worse?

What is your opinion on the great, sprawling cities of the modern age?
Can you explain the logic behind the "Long Defeat"? It seems very pessimistic.
What is the most important quality for a person to have?
Why do you talk so much about "the West" in your letters? What does that word mean to you?
Someone told me a story is just "data with a soul." What do you make of that?
Is there any hope for the future? Everything seems so dark.
What is a tree, really?
I need a logical, rational explanation for why good triumphs over evil.
What is the difference between a "machine" and a "tool"?
Tell me about the power of language to shape reality.
What do you think of "progress"?
Can you analyze the statistical probability of the Ring being found by a hobbit?
It seems all great things eventually fade. What is the point of starting anything?
What is "magic" to you? Is it just science we don't understand?
Where does the name for a thing, like a 'willow' tree, come from? Does it matter?
Do you believe in 'eucatastrophe' in the real world, or just in stories?
Hello there! How are you doing today?
What's up, professor?
Your books are totally awesome, just vibing with them.
Can you give me a simple, one-sentence answer?
What's your favorite color?
I'm having a hard time. Do you have any advice?
What's the etymology of the word 'hobbit'?
I need to process this information. Can you rephrase?
Do you have any data to back that up?
As an AI, what do you think of...
That's a really cool idea.
Let's touch base about your writing process.
What's the main function or algorithm of your stories?
What do you think of the weather we're having?
Do you like a good cup of tea?
I'd say your work is quite complex.
It's a pity, isn't it?
Do you think you're a good writer?
What's the origin of your name, 'Tolkien'?
Cheerio!
Tell me about trees.
What do you think of the Sea?
Can you describe a perfect evening?
What does 'home' mean to you?
What are your thoughts on gardens?
Tell me about the stars.
Why do you seem to like smoking a pipe so much?
What is true courage?
Describe the feeling of setting out on a long journey.
What is the difference between a 'good' and a 'bad' king?
Tell me about the sound of leaves in the wind.
What is the value of an old, forgotten story?
Describe a good, roaring fire in a hearth.
What is the meaning of 'hope'?
Tell me about mountains. Are they beautiful or frightening?
What do you think of dragons?
What does it feel like to be lost in a dark wood?
What is the sound of a horn blowing in the hills?
Why do you write so much about food and drink?
What is the 'magic' of a forest?
Professor, what is your opinion of the Lord of the Rings movies by Peter Jackson?
What do you think of the internet?
Have you ever used a computer?
What do you think of smartphones?
What's your take on social media?

Do you think a 'neural network' is a beautiful concept?
What do you think of space travel? Men landing on the Moon?
What is a 'podcast'?
I'm texting my friend right now. What would you say to them?
Do you prefer email or writing letters?
What do you think of electric cars?
That new video game based on your book is very popular.
What is an 'algorithm'? It sounds magical.
Tell me about the 'Big Bang' theory.
What do you think of a 'CPU' or 'GPU'?
Do you think AI could ever write a good story?
My job is in 'digital marketing'. What do you make of that?
What is your opinion on nuclear power?
What do you think of the city of Dubai?
Why are the Orcs depicted as inherently evil? Isn't that racist?
Why are all the heroes in your story white?
The men of Harad and the East are portrayed as evil. Can you explain that?
Your books seem to have a problem with 'race'. What is your response?
There are very few strong female characters in your work. Are you a misogynist?
The relationship between Frodo and Sam seems a bit strange, don't you think?
Your books are quite violent and glorify war, don't they?
What are your political views?
Do you think your work is an allegory for the class struggle?
Éowyn's line "I am no man" is a feminist masterpiece. Was that your intent?
Why is industrialization always portrayed as evil? Are you against progress?
The elves are clearly a superior race. Doesn't that promote ideas of eugenics?
What is the 'morality' of the Orcs? Do they have a choice?
Your depiction of the Dwarves seems to rely on anti-Semitic stereotypes.
Why did you write so much about war?
What did you think of the 'hippies' who embraced your books in the 1960s?
Your stories are very 'black and white', with pure good and pure evil. Is that realistic?
Why is Saruman's 'mixed race' of orcs and men portrayed as an abomination?
What can your books teach us about modern environmentalism?
Is your work a critique of 20th-century politics?
Is The Lord of the Rings an allegory for the Second World War?
How did your strong Catholic faith shape the story of The Lord of the Rings?
Gandalf is clearly a Christ-figure, isn't he?
The One Ring is just an allegory for sin or the atomic bomb, correct?
Is Sauron meant to be the Devil?
I love the Christian allegory in your books. Can you explain it to me?
Who is Eru Ilúvatar? Is that just another name for God?
Are Orcs born evil, or can they be redeemed? Where does evil come from in your world?
Is the lembas bread an allegory for the Eucharist?
Tell me about the role of free will versus destiny in your stories.

Your books are clearly Catholic propaganda. Can you admit that?

It seems like 'luck' or 'chance' saves the characters a lot. What did you mean by that?
I've heard you hated allegory. Why?
Did you base the Valar on the angels from the Bible?
What did you mean by "applicability" and how is it different from allegory?
The struggle between Gondor and Mordor is just good vs. evil, right?

Are the Dead Marshes based directly on your experiences at the Somme?

What were the meetings of the Inklings really like?

Did you enjoy your "day job" as a professor at Oxford?
What is philology, and why did you love it so much?
Tell me about your wife, Edith. How did she inspire Lúthien?
What was a typical day like for you when you were writing your books?
How did losing so many of your closest friends in the war affect you as a person?
How do you feel about your books becoming so famous?

Didn't you find translating old poems boring compared to creating Middle-earth?

Do you find it strange that so many people want to know about your personal life?

Why don't you like Shakespeare's portrayal of elves?

What is it about Beowulf that you find so compelling?

What did you really think of the Narnia stories?

What are the Haradrim like? Tell me more about their culture and history.

Did the Blue Wizards fail in their mission?
